title: Distributed Systems Demo Quiz: P2P & Time/Global States

questions.prompt: What is a defining characteristic of peer-to-peer (P2P) systems?
options: A central server coordinates all communication
All nodes have the same functional capabilities and responsibilities
Nodes cannot directly access each other's resources

questions.prompt: Which of the following is an advantage of P2P systems?
options: Ability to exploit unused resources at hosts for scalability
Easier management of mutable data compared to centralized servers

questions.prompt: Which architecture relies on a central server that stores metadata and performs lookups, such as in the original Napster?
What type of overlay controls network topology tightly and places files at specific locations?
Which of the following is TRUE about unstructured P2P networks?
options: Resource locations are known by all peers
Content is placed according to an organized topology
Finding resources typically requires searching or flooding
Each peer is responsible for a specific range of object IDs

questions.prompt: Which peer-to-peer system generation includes middleware layers for application-independent resource management?
In distributed systems, what causes **clock drift**?
options: Different hardware and environmental conditions affecting local clocks

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of synchronizing physical clocks in a distributed system?
options: To ensure all processes always execute at the same speed
To ensure timestamps reflect a sufficiently consistent notion of time
To guarantee all messages arrive in FIFO order

questions.prompt: Which synchronization approach uses a time server and adjusts the local clock based on half the round-trip delay?
What is the main limitation of using physical time to determine event ordering in distributed systems?
options: Local clocks are always perfectly synchronized
Message passing delays make precise timestamp ordering unreliable
Processes do not maintain histories of events

questions.prompt: What problem does clock skew represent?
options: Different processes record different times for events due to clock differences
Only one process can maintain accurate time

questions.prompt: Which best describes a process’s history in the time/global-state model?
options: A random sequence of events unrelated to system state
A series of events that occurred in the process in total order
A collection of timestamps from other nodes
A tree structure of all messages sent and received by the network
